description: Propose SAP-019 (Minimal Ecosystem Entry) for inclusion in chora-base SAP collection. Enable lightweight ecosystem onboarding (Bronze tier) to accelerate parallel execution across repos.
context: chora-workspace has designed SAP-019 to address ecosystem entry friction. Current barrier: 18 SAPs (~100k tokens, 2-4 weeks) required for participation. SAP-019 reduces this to 5 essential SAPs (~29k tokens, 3-5 hours) for Bronze tier entry. This spike is part of broader initiative to enable agent onboarding across chora ecosystem repos via minimal SAP package teaching, prioritizing parallel execution where ecosystem-level scope complements local work.
acceptance_criteria: chora-base team reviews SAP-019 (5 artifacts: Charter, Protocol, Guide, Blueprint, Ledger)
Feedback provided on SAP-019 structure, content, and integration with existing SAPs
Decision made: Accept for inclusion, Request revisions, or Defer
If accepted: SAP-019 assigned official SAP ID in chora-base SAP index
If accepted: Integration plan created for adding SAP-019 to chora-base docs/skilled-awareness/
Minimal SAP set (SAP-000, SAP-001, SAP-009, SAP-019, +1 domain) validated by chora-base team

deliverables: SAP-019 artifacts (capability-charter.md, protocol-spec.md, awareness-guide.md, adoption-blueprint.md, ledger.md)
Inbox protocol adoption in chora-workspace (inbox/ structure, README, schemas)
Pilot adoption record (chora-workspace self-adoption of Bronze tier)
success_metrics: chora-base team acknowledges receipt within 72 hours
At least 1 round of feedback provided
Clear next steps defined (accept, revise, defer)

additional_context.motivation: Enable chora ecosystem repos to onboard quickly with minimal learning overhead. Support parallel execution model where ecosystem-level coordination happens alongside local development priorities. Teach agents multimodal communication via SAP system.

related_work.sap_framework: SAP-000 defines 5-artifact pattern, SAP-019 follows this structure
related_work.inbox_protocol: SAP-001 provides coordination mechanism, SAP-019 integrates inbox adoption into Bronze tier
related_work.agent_awareness: SAP-009 defines AGENTS.md protocol, SAP-019 requires AGENTS.md for Bronze tier
related_work.chora_compose: SAP-017/018 demonstrate lightweight (SAP-017) vs. comprehensive (SAP-018) documentation split, SAP-019 follows this pattern

questions_for_chora_base: Does SAP-019 align with chora-base vision for ecosystem onboarding?
Should SAP-019 be numbered SAP-019, or renumbered to fit chora-base SAP sequence?
Are there existing patterns in chora-base that SAP-019 should reference or integrate with?
What's the process for proposing new SAPs to chora-base? (This coordination request follows inbox protocol, but is this the right channel?)
Would chora-base team like to collaborate on refining SAP-019 before inclusion?
Are there other repos in the ecosystem that should pilot SAP-019 before it's finalized?
collaboration_modes: Review and feedback: chora-base reviews SAP-019 artifacts, provides written feedback via inbox response or GitHub issues
Collaborative editing: chora-base team and chora-workspace team co-author revisions to SAP-019
Pilot expansion: chora-base identifies 2-3 repos to pilot SAP-019 Bronze tier adoption, gather feedback
Integration planning: Define how SAP-019 gets added to chora-base (file locations, SAP index update, cross-references)

notes.author: chora-base-team
notes.note: Reviewed and responded. Decision: Implement SAP Sets feature in Wave 5 instead of formal SAP-019. This solves the lightweight entry problem while maintaining v4.0 flexible adoption philosophy. Response files: inbox/outgoing/COORD-2025-001-response.json and COORD-2025-001-response-summary.md
